Table 1: Quantitative results on the 3DMatch dataset, STD: 
standard deviation. The symbol '-' means the results are 
unavailable or STD under low FMRs (<10%).

Table 2: Quantitative results on the 3DMatch dataset using 
different numbers of sampled points.

KITTI odometry dataset. The scores of baselines are re-
trieved from

Table 4: Quantitative results on the ETH dataset. Note that, 
all methods are only trained on the indoor 3DMatch dataset. 
The FMR scores at ? 1 = 10cm, ? 2 = 5% are compared.

Table 5: Quantitative results of different methods on the 
indoor 3DMatch dataset. Note that, all methods are only 
trained on the outdoor KITTI dataset.

Table 7: The FMR scores of all ablated models on the 
3DMatch and ETH datasets with ? 1 = 0.1cm.

Table 8: Average recall (%) of different methods on the 3DMatch benchmark with ? 1 = 10cm and ? 2 = 0.05. The symbol 
'-' means the results are unavailable and  ? means the results are reported from [13], which is different from Table 1.
